column5: Less than 3 weeks

I mailed my old passport and check (and the completed request form) to their Philadelphia office and had my new passport back within 3 weeks....and they returned my old passport a few days later. Rich B
a renewal always is faster then getting one for the first time
I did mine over Christmas break and get them back in four weeks with the standard service.
I just sent in my passport that expired this month. Applied for passcard don't need the passport. Only cost with your expired passport enclosed is $30
RENEWED Mine on Feb 16th; received back on Mar. 1st....
Can you give some details on how you did this?

go to their website: travel.state.gov > Passports & International Travel > Your Passports and follow the instructions. You might have to go from passport info to passcard info page but the link will at least get you to the site. You can print out the form,fill it out then you have to mail it with your passport & a new passport photo and the check for $30.

Passport Update:Mailed in Old One on March 30They received it April 4In my mail box April 18I paid 8.79 to mail First Class, Certified and return receipt.Thanks for all the replies . I can always count on WC for Great Advise !!<*((((<>

Remember - You do not need a passport to go to Canada - just a state issued pic id (usually your DL) and your birth certificate. Most people don't know that. You do not need a passport when driving into Canada.Technically you need one to reenter the US, but we have NEVER had an issue with our guests. Many to this day still dont have a passport.Good LuckPS - this is quoted from the CBSA web site"Identification requirements for U. S. citizens and permanent residentsIf you are a U.S. citizen, ensure you carry proof of citizenship such as a passport, birth certificate, a certificate of citizenship or naturalization, or a Certificate of Indian Status along with photo identification. If you are a U.S. permanent resident, ensure you carry proof of your status such as a U.S. Permanent Resident Card."
Has anyone renewed lately ? If so how long did it take to get the new one ? I'm heading North May 25 Dont really want to pay extra $$$$ Thanks In Advance<*((((((<>
We just got our passports renewed for a cruise in a few weeks. They took about 2.5 weeks to get them. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
just renewed mine and it took 2-3 weeks
Just received my renewed passport. Took just under 3 weeks. If you not leaving until the end of May I would not pay for fast service.
Mine came back in less than 2 weeks! I did not think any branch of our Government could move that fast.
I got mine in 4 weeks, just regular service.
I renewed mine in early December with no expedited service. Check was cashed within a week and received it in the mail exactly two weeks after mailing.
Just renewed mid February & it took around 3 weeks.

My Passport Book expires 11 months from now and rather than spending $110 to get it renewed I would like to get a Passport Card instead, so does anyone know if I have to pay $55 for the first time applicant for the Passport Card or the $30 fee for a renewed card? https://travel.state.gov/content/pas...-and-Card.html

Personally, I'd go for the Passport again. It's only $11 a year over 10 years. Unless you plan to NEVER go flying international in the next 10 years, or need to make an emergency flight back home half way thru your Canadian fishing trip. then get the card. The card is only good for land border crossings, cant use it for international flights just my 2 pesos
